bill.title: Driving guidelines; revise regarding seat belt fines and driver's license laws.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Temporary Driving Permit Holders Less Than Twenty-one Years Old To Have At Least 30 Hours Of Documented Driving Experience Before Graduating To An Intermediate License Or Any Other Driver's License; To Prohibit An Intermediate License Holder From Driving More Than One Passenger During The First Six Months Of Holding An Intermediate License; To Amend Section 63-2-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fines For Failure To Wear A Seat Belt Restraint From Twenty-five Dollars To Seventy-five Dollars; To Provide That Fifty Dollars Of The Collected Fines Be Deposited In The Driver Training Penalty Assessment Fund; To Amend Section 37-25-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.
